transcripts.text: Well, I hate to say this on your show, but you've been a long, good friend of mine.  I have to admit, I don't want to be stereotypical, but yes, he was 100% Negro, and I hope you invite me back here.
I love your people.
I've done so much for you, but it's a shame.
Where you at?  All right.  Ladies and gentlemen, we bringing them on right now.  Answer the hard questions.  B-Lad, where you at?
All right, all right, man.  Lord Jamar, Godfrey, what's up?
Ah, I see you're the disembodied voice that you usually are, huh?

Nah, man.  I can't get on camera.  I've been doing this for a long time, about 10 years.  I'm not going to get on camera.  A lot of people ask me, why don't I get a camera?  It's not going to happen.  I'd just rather you guys do the interviews and I just stay off the camera.  But what's up?  How you doing?  Nice to be on your show.

Yeah, so what's all this shit, man?  Like, You're on some bullshit right now for not apologizing to the minister.  What's the purpose of your disrespect towards the people that basically made you a millionaire?  What's that all about?

Listen, I looked at what I did.  I made a statement.  I made a statement that I made a mistake.  I already made a mistake.  I want to move on.  I'm not going to let people try to make it seem like they're not going to bully me into apologizing.  I made a mistake and I said it.  I made a statement.  I said, I made a mistake.  I misquoted the minister.  And that was it.  I mean, I don't know what the problem is.  I mean, I've done it.  I even asked to sit down not to.  And I even said that the FOI or the nation, they could use their cameras and use it for their own footage.  I didn't say, come on, my thing just to get to get ratings.  I didn't say that.  So I've done my part.
But doesn't any journalistic outlet, if they make a mistake and they have to make a retraction or something, don't they usually apologize for the mistake?
Don't they usually?  Isn't that...
I think that...

I think, Lord Jamar, you've been on my show a lot of times.  I'm a man, I'm gonna stand for what I believe in.  And I think that my statement was good enough.  I just feel like I'm being bullied.  It's more like a bullying thing.  I mean, everything I've done, it's not good enough.  I've even talked, they wanted to bring a representative to sit down.  And talk to me.  I said, I would rather personally, or even if it's a phone call, to apologize to the minister.  And they refused that.  So what am I supposed to do?  And I said, I don't need you to come on the show.  I'm not trying to clout chase.  What I'm trying to do is I want to apologize as a man and apologize to you.  You understand?  So I don't even understand.  But they've refused it.  So I'm going to stand with what I believe in.  I mean, I understand if you guys don't agree with me, that's fine.  That's fine.  i mean you know it is what it is.
it really is man we don't agree with you and so we're gonna stand with our people.  you stand with your people and um that'll be that.

Well, all right.  I mean, listen, I respect you guys.  You know, we've hung out a few times, me, you, all of us.  And I respect you guys and what you do.  And, you know, as long as we respect each other, there's no hate.  If you never talk to me again or whatever, you know, who knows?  But, you know, I respect that.  That's why I came on your show right now.  All right.  You know, it is what it is.  And, you know, I mean, I don't know what to say, you know.  And I tried.  I put my hand out.  I tried to make amends.  And, you know, They didn't want to agree with that, but I don't want to be sitting here... It's not going to be done on your terms, though.

See, that's the thing.  It's not going to be done on your terms.  It's going to be done on our terms.  We've decided... as a collective that you need to apologize.  And if you don't apologize, you're being canceled by the people.  Period.

I know it is what it is.  I mean, it is what it is.  I mean, I'm doing fine with or without you guys.  I mean, you know, it is what it is.  But it's not to put anybody down.  It's, you know, I mean, I just got to keep it going.  This hasn't happened to me before.  You know, I've had disagreements with a lot of people.  I had disagreements with Nick Cannon.  I've had disagreements with Charlamagne Tha God.  And we're cool now.  But it happens, you know, we just as long as we're made about it, you know, it is what it is.  But all right.  I mean, hey, what are you going to do?  Lord Jamar, it's nice to be on your show, you know?

Yeah, well, well, I guess that's that, man.  You know, it's unfortunate that you that you come to this fucking decision.  And yeah, don't be a problem for you now.  You're going to see the gradual descent.  Um, and it's not going to be pretty, and I hope, uh, uh, uh, apology doesn't come too little too late.
Uh, well, all right, man.  You guys take it easy.
All right.  Bring God.

Fuck all of you.  Fuck all of you.  Fuck y'all.  I don't give a fuck about none of you stupid motherfuckers.  I don't need another motherfucker chance.  You know why?  Because I don't give a fuck.  I said I don't give a fuck.  I don't give a fuck.  I don't give a fuck!  I don't give a fuck!  I don't give a fuck!  I don't give a fuck!
